page.title: 18TOURISM IN FORDYCE AREA
page.content: Fordyce is a tiny village with only l34 inhabitants,yet,though there is no residential hotel, a great number of visitors come in summer, for, not only is it a historic showcase but it is a good centre for car tourists to the Moray Firth. It has had amenities developed to encourage tourists and it is proposed to construct toilets and other conveniences for them. The new licensed Hawthorne Restaurant,opened in l984,serves meals 'with a local flavour' to its guests. There is a beautiful park, formerly the village bleaching green, which was planted out with young trees in l967 and made into a picnic area with tables and bench seats. Ben Cummings' Well was built there,beside Fordyce Burn,in l953 - Coronation Year - so that visitors can have a drink from a clear mountain stream.
